decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures with cards that provide support and protection, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, while Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional value by bouncing creatures and triggering their abilities again. The deck also features disruptive cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile support cards, this deck aims to rapidly build a threatening board presence and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to quickly assemble a powerful combo that can win the game without needing lands. By utilizing cards such as Commandeer, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building towards a game-winning play with Goblin Charbelcher. With a mix of counterspells, ramp, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game until it can unleash its combo and secure victory.

This deck aims to control the game through ramping up mana using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like World Breaker and Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator allows for access to powerful artifacts like Bojuka Bog to exile opponent's graveyard and stop graveyard strategies. The deck utilizes a mix of ramp, control, and powerful Eldrazi creatures to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy using Merfolk creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards that provide support for the Merfolk tribe, such as Lords and tribal synergy cards. The deck also includes disruptive elements like counterspells and removal to maintain tempo and protect its creatures. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with utility lands like Mutavault and Cavern of Souls. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence, apply pressure, and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Underworld Breach combo in combination with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and various artifacts to create a powerful engine for card advantage and repetitive spellcasting. The deck focuses on creating a loop of casting cheap artifacts from the graveyard using Underworld Breach, grinding through the opponent's resources with Grinding Station, and finishing off with a win condition such as Grapeshot or Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient combo strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, while utilizing creatures like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to control the board. It uses powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also incorporates graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and a mana base that allows for flexibility in casting spells. The goal is to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's resources to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game without relying on traditional lands. By using cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to tutor for key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while setting up a game-winning combo. Consign to Memory and Sink into Stupor provide additional disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to stop the deck's explosive plays.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a Boros color scheme, utilizing powerful creatures like Guide of Souls and Ranger-Captain of Eos to establish board presence quickly. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide added reach and removal options to maintain pressure on the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah acts as a game finisher while cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help control the board against opposing strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient aggro game plan in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to dominate the battlefield. With cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Thraben Charm for additional value, combined with removal spells like Static Prison, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently. The mana base is built around fetch lands like Arid Mesa and Marsh Flats to ensure consistent mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Underworld Breach combo alongside Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to quickly mill through the deck and find Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Mishra's Bauble and Soul-Guide Lantern to control the opponent's board state and provide protection. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, while also having the flexibility to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It combines efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude with disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out games with powerful creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Emperor of Bones. The deck also includes graveyard hate in the form of Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard-based strategies. By applying pressure while disrupting the opponent, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces necessary to abuse the Underworld Breach card, allowing for powerful graveyard recursion and card advantage. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station are key pieces to enable this combo, while also utilizing artifacts and cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and dig through the deck. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Pithing Needle to control the board while setting up the combo win condition.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with a variety of counterspells and removal spells while utilizing powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Cling to Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently remove threats while building a board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with a well-paced and aggressive approach.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed for the powerful interaction between Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. By utilizing various artifact and spell interactions, the deck aims to generate infinite loops that result in dealing large amounts of damage to the opponent with cards like Grapeshot or Malevolent Rumble, or decking them out with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Spell Snare to protect the combo and control the game state.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board with spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early attacks from creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also utilizing powerful spells like Leyline Binding and Tribal Flames to maintain board control and deal direct damage. The mana base is built for consistency and the inclusion of cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Scion of Draco adds versatility and additional win conditions to the aggressive strategy.

This Ruby Storm deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and medallions to cast spells like Gifts Ungiven and Ral, Monsoon Mage to set up a combo finish with cards like Grapeshot. The deck utilizes cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to generate mana efficiently, and uses Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard for additional value. With a mix of card draw and spell recursion, this deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.
